column4: Hibernate through the shell?  What's the command for hibernate + suspend?
there's no command for it. there's applications that do it, and there's a hibernate.sh file somewhere on the HD that does it, but they don't work effectively
Ah. I'll try google.  Maybe somebody came up with a solution.
try locate hibernate.sh and then bind it to an alias if you like
like bind the location to an alias
you'll probably have to type ./hibernate.sh from the directory to start it
ps, let me know if you get it working properly ;)
I think the command is... sudo /etc/acpi/sleepbtn.sh -- I'll try it soon. :o
i'll give it a shot. thanks
Were you able to hibernate successfully on your machine?  I don't think I ever did for my side.
If so, would you try the command?  "sudo pmi action hibernate"
i couldn't so i gave up a while back, but there's an application that doe it
apparently it's unsafe to hibernate without the application
I did came back from hibernate (sorta).  I wasn't able to use my bluetooth keyboard/mouse when resume.
